King's Shield creates mind games with opposing revenge killers, often rendering them null as a threat; V-create is another good choice that allows Primal Groudon to immediately threaten bulky unresisted foes, such as Wonder Guard Slaking, Mega Audino, and Cresselia, much more effectively, forcing them out more often. Primal Groudon has several options for its item; Leftovers synergizes particularly well with King's Shield and increases Primal Groudon's longevity, Lum Berry potentially gifts Primal Groudon a free turn to set up, and Mental Herb allows Primal Groudon to set up against Prankster Giratina lacking Glare or Spore much more easily, nearly always forcing a sack. Mold Breaker allows Primal Groudon to ignore Wonder Guard, allowing it to take full advantage of Thousand Arrows's amazing neutral coverage. The given spread maximizes physical bulk while allowing Primal Groudon to outspeed Pokemon with 150 base Speed, such as Deoxys-Attack and Mega Aerodactyl, after a Shell Smash; an Adamant nature further increases Primal Groudon's offensive prowess, allowing it to 2HKO Giratina after Shell Smash.

Primal Groudon fits on nearly every team structure, as its combination of base stats, great STAB moves, and ability to threaten other top metagame threats' checks make it too good to forgo. Prankster Giratina is Primal Groudon's best partner, as it can Imposter-proof Primal Groudon and use Will-O-Wisp or Glare to grant Primal Groudon more opportunities to set up. Giratina also has the option of running Destiny Bond, which is especially useful against Huge Power Mega Gyarados, a common switch-in to Primal Groudon. Despite its impressive bulk, Primal Groudon appreciates being brought in safely by Substitute + Baton Pass users like Wonder Guard Xerneas and Magic Bounce Giratina. Specially offensive Mold Breaker users like Mega Diancie, Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, and Dialga are great partners to threaten Giratina. In particular, Dialga is an excellent partner, as it can check Gale Wings users and Mega Gyarados lacking Sucker Punch, two common revenge killers to Primal Groudon. Offensive Wonder Guard users, like Xerneas, Mega Gardevoir, and Mega Lucario, are also quite good at forcing out most revenge killers that otherwise take full advantage of unboosted Primal Groudon. As Giratina is Primal Groudon's greatest obstacle, Huge Power Mega Gyarados is a great partner; it can also potentially force out a chipped Imposter user. Physically defensive Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, as well as Wonder Guard Mega Swampert, are good partners as well due to their ability to check unboosted Imposter users; the latter can also run a Substitute + Baton Pass set to allow offensive teammates to set up more easily. Lastly, Shadow Tag Mega Mewtwo X is a good partner, as with bulk investment it can survive Lum Berry Huge Power Mega Gyarados's Sucker Punch and OHKO back with a Fighting-type attack.

sets.name: Choice Band + Mold Breaker
sets.description:
Choice Band + Mold Breaker Primal Groudon is one of the most powerful Choice item attackers in the metagame due to its incredible STAB moves, great defensive typing, immunity to burns, and amazing bulk. V-create is a ludicrously powerful STAB move that threatens the entirety of the unresisted metagame, notably OHKOing physically defensive Wonder Guard Slaking, Arceus, Mega Audino, and Cresselia after Stealth Rock. In contrast, Thousand Arrows is a virtually unresisted STAB move that is more spammable than V-create thanks to having no drawbacks, freely threatening slower Pokemon, such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas and Wonder Guard Mega Scizor, alongside paralyzed offensive Pokemon, like opposing Primal Groudon, chipped Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, slightly damaged Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Gengar. Beat Up is a great coverage option to heavily damage Prankster Giratina and the rare Mega Slowbro, which would ordinarily switch in on Choice Band Primal Groudon. Alternatively, Precipice Blades still 2HKOes Giratina while also threatening non-Flying-types much more effectively than Beat Up; however, opposing Prankster Giratina has a good chance to successfully fish for a miss by repeatedly using Recover. Knock Off item removal can be useful when forcing mind games, especially against defensive Wonder Guard users running Shed Shell when running a Shadow Tag teammate, and it still threatens Magic Bounce Giratina if Giratina has an intact item and even slight chip damage. Trick is a great option to incapacitate Prankster Giratina, supporting offensive and Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard teammates by shutting down their largest counter. U-turn allows Primal Groudon to retain momentum for its team, as well as continually forcing chip damage against its main check in Giratina. Primal Groudon outspeeds most relevant threats without Speed investment at +2, and the extra HP investment helps it survive -ate Speed from users like Abomasnow.

Primal Groudon works best on bulky offense teams, which appreciate its ability to force coinflip scenarios against slower teams and create momentum for offensive teammates. Prankster Giratina benefits Primal Groudon greatly by Imposter-proofing it thanks to its massive physical bulk and V-create resistance. Since opposing Prankster Giratina is Primal Groudon's most common switch-in, Huge Power Dark-types that can remove it with Pursuit, such as Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal, are valuable partners for it; they can also heavily damage most Choice item + Shadow Tag users, which pick a weakened Primal Groudon off. In particular, Mega Gyarados is great, as it can also switch into an opposing Shell Smash Primal Groudon if healthy and force it out with Water Shuriken. Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users allow Primal Groudon to come in safely with a Substitute, helping it beat offensive Pokemon like opposing Primal Groudon and Protean Mega Latios one-on-one. In particular, Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas has great utility in forcing Prankster Giratina and most Magic Bounce users out with Moonblast, and it can run a diverse array of support options in its filler moveslot, such as Stealth Rock, Defog, Aromatherapy, paralysis support in Glare, Dark Void, Taunt, and even Wish or Shell Smash support for Primal Groudon. Special Mold Breaker users, especially more powerful ones like Mega Latios, Mega Diancie, Choice Specs Mega Rayquaza, and Dialga, can force Giratina out after Primal Groudon uses U-turn. Paralysis support from the likes of Prankster Giratina, as well as select support Wonder Guard users, can make Primal Groudon even more threatening by providing free turns. Also, Primal Groudon can force out paralyzed offensive threats like Mega Gengar, Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y lacking a Choice Scarf, Mega Latios, and special Mega Rayquaza. Shadow Tag users can work well with Knock Off Primal Groudon, as the likes of Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre and bulky Gastro Acid + Wonder Guard users like Arceus are secondary switch-ins to it. Entry hazard setters, such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users, defensive Wonder Guard users, and bulky Mold Breaker teammates, can bolster Primal Groudon's offensive prowess, as the additional chip damage from Stealth Rock affects Primal Groudon's KO rolls in a wide variety of instances. Defensive Wonder Guard users can provide Defog and Aromatherapy support, keeping Primal Groudon healthy over the course of a game.

Rayquaza.comments:
Other Options

Dragon Claw threatens Prankster Giratina more effectively than Dragon Ascent; however, it is hard to fit and usually not worth it over a coverage option. Additionally, Gear Grind has better rolls than Dragon Ascent to OHKO the common Xerneas, but it mostly isn't worth it because Dragon Ascent usually OHKOes Xerneas anyway. V-Create is a powerful alternative to Sacred Fire, KOing Mega Steelix after minor chip damage and making Mega Rayquaza slightly easier to imposter-proof; however, its drawbacks mean Mega Rayquaza is usually forced out after using the move once, and it doesn't spread status like Sacred Fire does. A Jolly nature can be used to outspeed opposing neutral nature Mega Rayquaza, Modest Arceus, and Timid Mega Diancie and Mega Latios, though the extra pressure Adamant brings against Prankster Giratina is usually better. Mega Rayquaza can also use entry hazards like Spikes and Stealth Rock, as it often forces many switches. Waterfall and Steam Eruption are more accurate alternatives to Crabhammer, but they do not KO Mega Tyranitar after Stealth Rock like Crabhammer does. Close Combat can be used to hit Normal-types like Arceus and Slaking, but is outclassed by Sacred Fire in most cases. Thousand Arrows is another decent option, which hits the Electric-types that resist Mega Rayquaza's Dragon Ascent, but is also usually outclassed by Sacred Fire.

Checks and Counters

Prankster Giratina: Prankster Giratina is one of the few Pokemon that can switch in on Choice Band Mega Rayquaza and live to tell the tale. While Choice Band-boosted Dragon Ascent 2HKOes it, it can heal and PP stall with its priority recovery. Additionally, priority status moves like Glare can hinder Mega Rayquaza's ability to consistently threaten foes later in the game. Additionally, some Prankster Giratina sets elect to run Destiny Bond, which can make a Mega Rayquaza sweep short.

Shadow Tag: Offensive Shadow Tag users, like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y, can consistently trap and KO Mega Rayquaza with their powerful attacks. Additionally, Perish Song trappers such as Lugia and Arceus commonly run King's Shield, which can remove Rayquaza's strongest asset in its high attack, as well as removing it with Perish Song.

Priority Users: Common priority users like Refrigerate Kyurem-B and Mega Abomasnow, Pixilate Mega Diancie, Aerilate Mega Rayquaza, Extreme Speed Regigigas, and Huge Power + Sucker Punch Dark-types can reliably KO Mega Rayquaza after Dragon Ascent's defense drops. These threats can effectively force a coinflip scenarios, KOing Rayquaza with priority if it stays in and getting good dama with Pursuit if it decides to switch out.

Stealth Rock: Stealth Rock heavily punishes Mega Rayquaza due to its pivot-heavy playstyle, chipping it every time it switches in. However, Stealth Rock is rather difficult to consistently keep on the field, as a teammate with Defog can remove Stealth Rock then potentially bring Mega Rayquaza in with a pivot move.

King's Shield Users: Activating King's Shield with a contact move potentially nullifies Mega Rayquaza's ability to break walls and secure KOs. However, King's Shield users must be healthy, as well as sufficiently bulky enough, to switch into Mega Rayquaza and hamper its offensive prowess.

Imposter: Defense drops from Dragon Ascent mean that Imposter users can effectively force out Mega Rayquaza, even if they don't hold a Choice Band.

sets.name: Choice Band + Mold Breaker
sets.description:
Moves

Mega Rayquaza uses its sky-high Attack stat primarily to obliterate foes with its STAB Dragon Ascent, which deals huge damage to everything that doesn't resist it. Sacred Fire is used to hit Steel-type Pokemon, such as Wonder Guard Mega Scizor, Registeel, and Mega Steelix; it also finds great utility in its 50% burn chance, which constantly chips at bulky switch-ins like Prankster Giratina while weakening opposing Imposter users. Precipice Blades is another good option, OHKOing Mold Breaker Mega Tyranitar from full health and Primal Groudon after Stealth Rock. Crabhammer can be used to OHKO Primal Groudon and KO Mega Tyranitar after Stealth Rock, while Trick invalidates would-be checks like King's Shield users and Giratina by forcing them to stick to one status move. Extreme Speed is a great option for picking off weakened foes, especially with Mega Rayquaza's high Attack stat and Choice Band. U-turn takes advantage of Mega Rayquaza demanding switch-ins, as it allows you to conserve momentum. Mega Rayquaza's Mold Breaker allows it threaten opposing Wonder Guard users, letting it keep momentum even more effectively.

Rayquaza's most common check is Prankster Giratina, so naturally anything that can beat it pairs well with Mega Rayquaza. Mega Gyarados is an amazing option, as it can force coinflip scenarios against Giratina with its Huge Power-boosted Pursuit and Knock Off. Special Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie can continuously pressure Giratina. Mega Gengar in particular is amazing for its Speed, which lets it take care of fast threats that Mega Rayquaza can't; notably it Speed ties with Mega Mewtwo X and outspeeds opposing Mega Rayquaza, Timid Mega Latios, and Timid Mega Diancie. Slow pivots like Mega Audino, Mega Scizor, and Cresselia, allow Mega Rayquza to get into the field safely, capitalizing on its potential to pressure many Pokemon with its devastating attacks once in. Mega Rayquaza also appreciates the help from Aromatherapy and Defog users like Primal Kyogre and Mega Audino to remove status and Stealth Rock. This set can also be paired with a Choice Specs Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza as not only do they defeat each other's checks, but the opponent lack reliable counterplay due to not knowing which set is in. Mega Rayquaza pairs well with -ate Speed Pokemon because it takes advantage of their ability to force opposing Wonder Guards users in.

Lopunny.comments:
Focus Sash compensates for Mega Lopunny's poor bulk and allows it to freely switch moves. Sheer Cold is Mega Lopunny's primary weapon, OHKOing everything without Wonder Guard or fringe Sturdy. Sing takes advantage of Mega Lopunny's ability to force switches, putting opposing Wonder Guard switch-ins to sleep, and has additional utility through bypassing Substitute. Gastro Acid is used to force switches from Wonder Guard users that switch into Sheer Cold with impunity, allowing the user to use Sing on switches or make easier double switches into other teammates. Stealth Rock is used to sustain chip damage against opposing Wonder Guard users, while Dynamic Punch takes advantage of Mega Lopunny's Attack stat to threaten opposing Wonder Guard users weak to the move, such as Slaking, Arceus, and Mega Lucario. Maximum HP and Speed investment allows Mega Lopunny to outspeed as much as possible while also maximizing its overall bulk; If running attacking moves such as Dynamic Punch, HP investment should be forgone for Attack to maximize damage.

Mega Lopunny usually benefits best from being placed on fast-paced Offensive teams that like to quickly gain momentum and force switches. Some notable teammates include Mold breaker users such as Primal Groudon and Mega Latios that take advantage of foes that are put to sleep by Mega Lopunny and also benefit from the chip damage Mega Lopunny gives with Stealth Rock. Shadow Tag Pokemon such as Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Lugia are appreciated for their ability to remove Wonder Guard users and enable Mega Lopunny to sweep teams. However, Mega Lopunny will need sufficient hazard control if it hopes to keep it's Focus Sash intact. It benefits from Defog Users such as Wonder Guards and Magic Bounce users. These Pokemon also can slowly pivot so Mega Lopunny has a safer time getting on the field.

Other Options

Spikes and Toxic Spikes are alternatives to Stealth Rock to better damage Rock-resistant foes and pressure Wonder Guard users lacking reliable recovery respectively. Sticky Web can help teams that want more speed control and enables slower partners such as Primal Groudon, Mega Rayquaza, Mega Diancie, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga. Mega Lopunny can use some attacks such as Sacred Fire, Gunk Shot, and Dynamic Punch. However, these are fishing for specific weaknesses of certain Wonder Guard users and are much more situational, so they generally aren't the best options. Lastly, substituting Sheer Cold for Fissure can work to target ground weak Wonder Guard Users Ground-weak Wonder Guard users, but this also falls under situational matchup fishing.

Checks and Counters

Priority Revenge Killers Mega Lopunny can be revenge killed in many ways, ranging from Extreme Speed users such as Regigigas, Slaking, and -ate speed users to Water Shuriken Mega Gyarados, Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza, and even Prankster Giratina running Spore, Dark Void, or Destiny Bond.

Wonder Guard Users: While Mega Lopunny is meant to dismantle and force switches between Wonder Guard users, they can still block Trick with items like Mail, Mega Stones, and Primal Orbs. Magic Coat or Magic Bounce users can bounce back Sing and Hazards. Some Wonder Guard users also run attacks such as Xerneas with Moonblast or Kyogre-Primal with Scald and can force Lopunny-Mega out.

Faster Pokemon: Faster Pokemon, like Mega Mewtwo Y, Deoxys-S, and Choice Scarf users, can threaten Focus Sash Mega Lopunny out. Additionally, some Choice Scarf users, like Mega Mewtwo Y and No Guard Deoxys-S, can also outspeed Choice Scarf Mega Lopunny and threaten it. Choice Scarf Shadow Tag users, like Mega Rayquaza and Primal Groudon, can outspeed and KO chipped Focus Sash Mega Lopunny. However, most of these options require pivoting support from Wonder Guard teammates to come in on Mega Lopunny safely, and Choice Scarf users naturally slower than Mega Lopunny, like Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo X, are at risk of getting outsped and OHKOed by Choice Scarf Mega Lopunny.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
Mega Lopunny's high-Speed stat makes it a good No Guard user, as Speed is integral to this utility-centered role. Sheer Cold, which always hits due to No Guard, can OHKO any foe without Wonder Guard or the fringe Sturdy. This allows Mega Lopunny to force opposing Wonder Guard users in with ease. Trick allows Mega Lopunny to disrupt opposing Wonder Guard users; it's best to use Trick early, as getting rid of Choice Scarf gives Mega Lopunny more opportunities to force switches due to Gastro Acid. Mega Lopunny capitalizes on the switches it forces with either Stealth Rock, for entry hazard control and chip damage, or a sleep move like Sing to put opposing Wonder Guard users to sleep. Sing is significantly better than most sleep moves for bypassing Substitute. Mega Lopunny shouldn't afraid to make double switches, as it all but ensures an opposing Wonder Guard user comes in; making double switches is even easier if opposing Wonder Guard users are asleep, or if one is Tricked.

Mega Lopunny benefits from slow pivot teammates such as Magic Bounce Giratina and Wonder Guard Pokemon with Parting Shot or Baton Pass. This is because Mega Lopunny is rather frail and needs to get on the field in a safe way. Mega Lopunny is generally used on teams that lack utility or ways to forcibly gain momentum. Mega Lopunny nearly always needs an offensive Pokemon, such as Primal Groudon, Mega Latios, Mega Mewtwo X, or Mega Mewtwo Y, to help back it up and capitalize on the switches and momentum Mega Lopunny gives.

Lucario.comments:
Other Options

An alternate EV spread of 68 Atk / 252 SpA / 188 Spe alongside Bolt Strike is an option to OHKO physically defensive Primal Kyogre at +2 while still outpacing Jolly Primal Groudon. Similarly, a spread of 176 Atk / 252 SpA / 80 Spe with a Rash nature is an option alongside either Bolt Strike or Power Whip to OHKO Primal Kyogre while outpacing maximum speed Adamant Primal Groudon. A Timid or Naive nature is another option to outpace the somewhat rare Timid Mega Latios and Timid Mega Diancie.

Flame Plate is an option over Fist Plate to hit Bug- and Steel-type Wonder Guard users. However, using Flame Plate means that Mega Lucario sacrifices the ability to hit Normal-type Wonder Guard users and OHKO Primal Groudon at +2 unless it also sacrifices its ability to beat Imposter users. Earth Plate is also an option over Fist Plate that trades hitting Normal-type Wonder Guard users for Electric-type Wonder Guard users while retaining the ability to KO Primal Groudon at +2. However, this version of the set faces fierce competition from Dialga, which has superior bulk, higher Special Attack, and lacks a Fire weakness.

Mega Lucario also has a handful of other coverage options it can utilize. Bug Buzz does better against Cresselia than Knock Off, allowing Lucario to avoid mind games against King's Shield variants. Play Rough and Moonblast are both alternatives to hit Wonder Guard Mega Sableye; however, the former is an alternative to Knock Off that also OHKOes Mega Latios, while the latter offers similar coverage and hits harder overall. Scald can be used to OHKO Primal Groudon. Gastro Acid is an option to allow Mega Lucario to break through Wonder Guard users of any type at the somewhat steep cost of an additional turn to do so.

Checks and Counters

Fissure: Like all Ground-weak Wonder Guard users, Mega Lucario is vulnerable to the somewhat uncommon but still very dangerous Fissure.

Strong Attackers: Mega Lucario is very frail both specially and physically. If a powerful unresisted attack pierces its Wonder Guard, Mega Lucario will almost certainly be KOed. In addition, all three of Mega Lucario’s weaknesses are to very common attacking types, which means that most teams have multiple attackers that can bypass Mega Lucario's Wonder Guard. In particular, Mega Lucario is weak to both of Primal Groudon's STAB attacks. Faster Mold Breaker attackers, such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Gengar, as well as those that can tank a hit, such as Protean Mega Latios, are all highly threatening to Mega Lucario.

Opposing Wonder Guard: Because Wonder Guard sweepers are inherently matchup dependent, Wonder Guard users that Mega Lucario is not packing the correct coverage moves for will force it out.

Item Removal: Trick, Switcheroo, and Mold Breaker Knock Off can severely impede Mega Lucario's ability to do its job, removing one-third of its coverage as well as its ability to beat Imposter users.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Offensive Shadow Tag users such as Primal Groudon or Mega Mewtwo X can pivot in on unboosted Mega Lucario and OHKO it. Very few offensive Shadow Tag users do not carry an attacking move that can KO Mega Lucario.

Prankster Giratina: Unless Mega Lucario is already boosted and just used a move that Giratina does not resist while it switches in, Prankster Giratina can come in freely on Mega Lucario and annoy it with Will-O-Wisp or Glare.

sets.name: Wonder Guard Shell Smash
sets.description:
Mega Lucario's decent typing for an offensive Wonder Guard user, quadruple resistance to Stealth Rock, strong attacking stats, and good base 112 Speed make it a powerful option for a Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweeper. The combination of Judgment and Fist Plate is a huge boon to Mega Lucario, allowing it to defeat Imposter users, Normal-type Wonder Guard users, and allowing it OHKO Primal Groudon after one Shell Smash. Flash Cannon and Gear Grind are both powerful STAB moves that hit Fairy-type Wonder Guard users. Flash Cannon's superior accuracy makes it the more consistent option and is slightly stronger against standard Wonder Guard Mega Audino. Gear Grind, on the other hand, is noticeably better against Wonder Guard Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir, breaking the former's Substitutes and outright OHKOing the latter without a boost. The final moveslot is flexible, as it is both metagame- and team-dependent, but notable options include: Freeze-Dry, Grass Knot, and Knock Off. Freeze-Dry and Grass Knot both do well against Water-type Wonder Guard users like Primal Kyogre. The former's greater coverage usually make it the preferred option, but Grass Knot's increased Base Power versus certain targets such as Whirlwind Primal Kyogre is valuable as well. Knock Off is a useful option, as it OHKOes Mega Latios at +2. Without Knock Off, Mega Latios can take any other hit from Lucario—even at +2—and OHKO back. Knock Off also gives Mega Lucario a way of damaging Psychic- and Ghost-type Wonder Guard users and has the additional utility of removing items, making switch-ins without Wonder Guard less safe. A Rash nature is preferred if physical attacks are used; otherwise, a Modest nature is preferred.

Mega Lucario fits best on balance and offense teams in need of a wincon and late-game cleaner. However, Mega Lucario differs from similar Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Xerneas, most notably because of its Fissure weakness, meaning that it appreciates teammates that can scout potential opposing No Guard users, such as Imposter users and slow pivots with Wonder Guard that don't share weaknesses with Mega Lucario, such as Cresselia, Slaking, and Primal Kyogre. In addition, a Flying-type teammate, such as Mega Rayquaza, can also help alleviate Mega Lucario’s Fissure weakness, as Sheer Cold + Fissure No Guard users are uncommon. Mega Lucario is also limited in its ability to beat certain Wonder Guard users, namely those weak to Fire- and Ground-type moves, without compromising its ability to beat Imposter users. As a result, Mega Lucario benefits from Choice Band Mold Breaker teammates that can break opposing Wonder Guard cores such as Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza. Offensive Shadow Tag teammates—Primal Groudon in particular—are also worth a mention, as they can trap and KO the Wonder Guard users Mega Lucario can't touch. Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users are also useful teammates, as they can give Mega Lucario additional opportunities to use Shell Smash and provide it some breathing room versus opposing Shadow Tag Primal Groudon, which would otherwise trap and KO Lucario. Finally, Mega Lucario also appreciates Aromatherapy, Defog, and Wish support from teammates such as the aforementioned slow pivoting Wonder Guard users to make its job as a wincon and late-game cleaner easier.

Drapion.overview: Drapion is slightly outclassed by Skuntank as a Poison / Dark Wonder Guard user. While Drapion has higher physical bulk, allowing it to survive hits like Primal Groudon's Thousand Arrows and Choice Band Mega Rayquaza's Dragon Ascent, Skuntank has slightly better special bulk and can pivot after Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, Primal Groudon, and minimum Speed Cresselia and Meloetta. As Drapion and Skuntank are functionally the same, Skuntank's analysis can be found here.

Abomasnow.comments:
Other Options

Mega Abomasnow can opt for V-Create instead of Boomburst to threaten Magic Bounce Steel-types like Registeel, as well as OHKO Wonder Guard Mega Scizor and Escavalier. However, forgoing Boomburst means Mega Abomasnow has a much more difficult time checking Shell Smash Mold Breaker Primal Groudon running King's Shield, and V-Create's main targets in Magic Bounce Steel-types are relatively uncommon. Sacred Fire is an alternative option which can provide utility with burns, but is usually not worth it as it fails to OHKO Mega Scizor or 2HKO Mega Steelix. Pursuit can also be used over Boomburst to trap opposing Mega Gengar, weakened Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios after a Shell Smash; however, it has the high opportunity cost of not being able to be run with Boomburst and a support move. Spikes, Toxic Spikes, and Sticky Web are options over Stealth Rock, as Mega Abomasnow adequately threatens Flying-types, and its teammates appreciate the chip offered by poison from Toxic Spikes and the Speed drop from Sticky Web. The consistent damage of Stealth Rock is generally more useful, however. Baton Pass can work over Parting Shot, as it allows Mega Abomasnow to pass Substitutes it received from a teammate to another offensive teammate while still offering universal pivoting. Taunt can be used on the switch to disable Wonder Guard switch-ins running four status moves. Spore is another option that also disables them by putting them to sleep, and the opponent cannot put Mega Abomasnow to sleep with a well-timed Magic Bounce switch-in. Recover is a fringe option to keep Mega Abomasnow healthy, though the opportunity cost of not running a support move is high. Running coverage in the last one or two moveslots is an option, with possible options being Petal Blizzard, Freeze-Dry, Gunk Shot, Knock Off, Thousand Arrows, Close Combat, Low Kick, and Play Rough. If running Freeze-Dry, an alternative spread of 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 SpA with a Brave nature could be used to force recovery from physically defensive Wonder Guard Primal Kyogre, but the added bulk from investing in HP is generally more worthwhile. Leftovers is a niche option over Icicle Plate, as it increases Mega Abomasnow's longevity throughout the game; however, forgoing Icicle Plate means Mega Abomasnow misses out on the OHKO against Giratina with Boomburst.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard Users: The vast majority of Wonder Guard users can switch in on Mega Abomasnow and render its Refrigerate-boosted attacks null. In particular, offensive Wonder Guard users are problematic, as they can't be revenge killed by Mega Abomasnow and, in a good matchup, can snowball through teams which have Mega Abomasnow as the sole setup check.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Offensive Shadow Tag users, especially bulky Mega Mewtwo X, can come in on Mega Abomasnow on a resisted move or Fake Out and OHKO it. In particular, Mega Mewtwo X with significant bulk investment and Primal Groudon are bulky enough to usually survive Fake Out into Extreme Speed and can OHKO Mega Abomasnow with Drain Punch or V-Create, respectively. However, most pivoting support is useless for offensive Shadow Tag users aiming to remove Mega Abomasnow due to its abysmal speed, and nearly all Shadow Tag users are vulnerable to getting KOed by Boomburst into Extreme Speed.

Huge Power Mega Gyarados: Despite Mega Abomasnow investing in HP to increase its bulk, Huge Power-boosted Pursuits are problematic for it. In particular, Mega Gyarados is an issue, as it can come in on Fake Out, Extreme Speed, or Boomburst safely if healthy.

Magic Bounce Steel-types: Magic Bounce Steel-types, such as Registeel and Mega Steelix, can prevent specific Mega Abomasnow sets from being able to support its team. However, Registeel can be threatened with V-Create or Sacred Fire, and Mega Steelix is blown past by Boomburst sets.

sets.name: Refrigerate
sets.description:
Refrigerate Mega Abomasnow is an excellent revenge killer that differentiates itself from other -ate Speed users with its resistance to Thousand Arrows, immunity to Spore, and low Speed stat that allows it to underspeed many of the format's slow pivots. Fake Out and Extreme Speed form a potent combination that allows Mega Abomasnow to threaten chip against sweepers lacking King's Shield and revenge weakened foes with its strong priority STAB attacks. Fake Out on its own is also able to chip opposing sweepers lacking King's Shield, letting Mega Abomasnow hard switch into unboosted sweepers on a prediction and either chip them or force them out. Boomburst is an incredibly powerful STAB move that with an Icicle Plate OHKOes opposing Giratina and allows Mega Abomasnow to force non-Wonder Guard users out the majority of the time if healthy. Stealth Rock allows Mega Abomasnow to support its team through entry hazard setting, capitalizing on Mega Abomasnow's ability to force out offensive threats; Parting Shot and Gastro Acid are good alternative options, as the former helps to retain momentum against even slow pivot Wonder Guard users like Mega Audino and Primal Kyogre, while the latter forces most opposing Wonder Guard users to switch due to the threat of Boomburst and Extreme Speed. Since Boomburst already OHKOes Giratina without any investment, Abomasnow can throw its EVs into HP and Attack. A Brave nature and 0 Speed IVs minimizes Mega Abomasnow's Speed, giving it the ability to underspeed slow pivots like Wonder Guard Mega Audino and Chansey.

Mega Abomasnow works best on teams that appreciate its ability to revenge kill non-Wonder Guard sweepers, such as offense, bulky offense, balance, and dual Mega Mewtwo X teams. In particular, it works well with the ubiquitous Shell Smash Primal Groudon + Prankster Giratina + Wonder Guard Xerneas core, as even Prankster Giratina proves to be insufficient counterplay to opposing Mold Breaker Primal Groudon on its own. Offensive pressure from Primal Groudon helps retain momentum against teams that rely on Wonder Guard Xerneas to come in on Mega Abomasnow, especially if Mega Abomasnow runs Parting Shot; Prankster Giratina, especially variants running Will-O-Wisp, can switch in on healthy Huge Power users using a Fighting-, Fire-, Poison-, or Steel-type attack and force them out with either Encore or the threat of a burn. Wonder Guard Xerneas can pass Substitutes to Mega Abomasnow, which allows Mega Abomasnow to set Stealth Rock or threaten opposing switch-ins with Gastro Acid. Mold Breaker users, in particular slower ones like Mega Tyranitar, Choice item Mega Rayquaza, and Mega Latios, also appreciate Mega Abomasnow's ability to revenge kill faster threats. On faster offensive teams, Imposter Chansey is a good partner, as Mega Abomasnow struggles to deal with King's Shield sweepers; in return, Mega Abomasnow can threaten Mega Gengar and Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, two Pokemon Imposter Chansey can't prevent from setting up easily. Offensive Shadow Tag users, in particular Mega Mewtwo X, Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios, are good partners for Parting Shot Mega Abomasnow due to being able to remove Wonder Guard users not running Shed Shell, such as Xerneas and Safety Goggles Primal Kyogre. Mega Abomasnow can work well on dual Mega Mewtwo X teams due to being a fairly reliable lone revenge killer, though it faces stiff competition from other -ate users such as Kyurem-B and Mega Rayquaza. Lastly, defensive Wonder Guard users are extremely valuable for Mega Abomasnow, as they can provide Defog, Aromatherapy, and Wish support, helping for removing entry hazards, protecting against Dark Void Mold Breaker sweepers, and providing for Mega Abomasnow's longevity respectively, while also disrupting Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users coming in and trying to set up with Whirlwind.

Regigigas.comments:
Other Options

Regigigas can use other priority moves instead of Bullet Punch, such as Shadow Sneak for Mega Gengar or Water Shuriken for Primal Groudon. However, Water Shuriken needs to hit all 5 times to OHKO Primal Groudon with a Defense drop, and Shadow Sheak requires Life Orb to always OHKO opposing Mega Gengar after a Shell Smash, making these moves generally not worth running. A set with Encore and Perish Song can be used over Bullet Punch and Spikes in order to trap passive Wonder Guard users without Shed Shell as well as opposing sweepers running King's Shield that are locked into the move, but the utility of Spikes and Bullet Punch are usually not worth forgoing. Other entry hazards such as Stealth Rock and Sticky Web can also be used in the place of Spikes, but Regigigas's ability to set multiple layers means Spikes is usually preferred. Coverage moves for Wonder Guard Pokemon such as Gunk Shot, Gear Grind, Sacred Fire, and Close Combat can also be used, but these moves are often not worth using as they are very matchup reliant. Recover is another option for the fourth moveslot, allowing Regigigas to heal off chip from entry hazards.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard Users: Most Wonder Guard users do not fear any of Regigigas's moves and can usually heal or set entry hazards in front of Regigigas. However, those lacking Shed Shell that underspeed Regigigas, like Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas and Safety Goggles Primal Kyogre, fear the uncommon Encore and Perish Song set.

Shed Shell Users: Pokemon holding Shed Shell avoid being trapped by Shadow Tag, removing Regigigas's main niche and allowing them to freely switch to a Pokemon that can beat Regigigas. However, these Pokemon must be wary of getting their item removed by one of Regigigas's teammates.

Giratina: Giratina is not threatened by any of Regigigas's moves and is unable to be trapped due to its Ghost typing, allowing it to threaten Regigigas with crippling status moves. Magic Bounce sets can also prevent Regigigas from setting entry hazards, completely shutting it down. Giratina is weak to Pursuit from Regigigas's teammates, but running Pursuit often defeats the purpose of Regigigas, so it is not common.

Faster Ghost, Rock, and Steel Pokemon: Offensive Pokemon who resist Regigigas's STAB moves such as Dialga and Gengar often don't fear any of Regigigas's moves and can set up freely against teams who rely on Regigigas as their main way of revenge killing.

King's Shield Mold Breaker Sweepers: King's Shield drops Regigigas's Attack sharply and prevents it from reliably revenging opposing Pokemon. However, Imposter Chansey is able to revenge most King's Shield users.

sets.name: Shadow Tag Revenge Killer
sets.description:
Shadow Tag Regigigas is one of the best revenge killers in the metagame, as it can trap and eliminate frail offensive Pokemon including Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, No Guard Deoxys-S, and many variants of Mega Mewtwo Y. Its main source of damage is the combination of Fake Out and Extreme Speed, allowing Regigigas to often deal large amounts of damage without taking any in return. This combination of moves notably KOes Deoxys-S, offensive Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios with slight chip. Bullet Punch is used to OHKO Mega Diancie after a Shell Smash, as well as chip Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas. Spikes capitalizes on the free turns Regigigas gets against passive Wonder Guard users such as Mega Audino and Mega Scizor, as well as Substitute + Baton Pass Xerneas lacking Glare, Dark Void, or Taunt. Regigigas is also often able to set 3 layers of Spikes vs passive Pokemon without Shed Shell, as they can not threaten it. Silk Scarf provides a boost to Regigigas's Normal-type STAB moves, allowing it to KO Deoxys-S, uninvested Mega Mewtwo Y, and Mega Latios with the combination of Fake Out and Extreme Speed. Additionally, Leftovers provides recovery that Regigigas can capitalize on by trapping passive Pokemon with Shadow Tag. Maximum Attack EVs with an Adamant nature allow Regigigas to hit as hard as possible, while an investment in HP increases Regigigas's longevity.

Regigigas fits mostly on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to trap and remove powerful offensive threats. Frail Mold Breaker sweepers such as Mega Gengar and Mega Diancie pair well with Regigigas, as removing offensive Pokemon allows them to set up more easily. Additionally, these Mold Breaker users can force out the metagame's most common Magic Bounce user in Giratina, which would otherwise prevent Regigigas from setting entry hazards. Mold Breaker Tyranitar is able to force Regigigas out, so Fairy- and Dark-type teammates such as Mega Diancie are good to have. Common Wonder Guard Pokemon such as Mega Scizor and Primal Kyogre are able to wall Regigigas, so the same Mold Breaker Pokemon also pair well with Regigigas, as they can eliminate these Pokemon. Imposter Chansey is another great partner, as the two of them can revenge almost all Pokemon except Mega Gengar and Dialga. Wonder Guard users also make good teammates, Regigigas is often able to remove the Mold Breaker Pokemon that threaten them. Pokemon with Trick, Mold Breaker Knock Off, or other forms of item removal are other helpful teammates, as Regigigas greatly appreciates Shed Shells being removed from opposing Wonder Guard users.

Giratina.comments:
Other Options

Baton Pass can be run on the first moveslot, as Giratina often incentivizes switching by threatening to use Encore; additionally, Baton Pass allows Giratina to switch out of Huge Power Pursuit users safely. Substitute is another option which allows Giratina to force attacks in tandem with Encore and scout against opposing Choice item Mold Breaker users in a 1v1 situation, but is generally not worth it as the opportunity cost of not running an additional utility move is very high. Toxic can be run to chip Mega Mewtwo X, Primal Groudon, and Wonder Guard Xerneas, but doesn't have Will-O-Wisp's ability to cripple most physical attackers or Glare's ability to hamper most Mold Breaker users' sweeping ability. Trick, especially with a detrimental item like Lagging Tail, allows Giratina to remove Plates from the many special Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Gengar, Mega Diancie, Dialga, and Mega Sceptile. As an alternative to Will-O-Wisp, Flame Orb + Psycho Shift prevents Dark Void from affecting Giratina and, in effect, spreads 100% accurate burns, but its downside includes Giratina needing to recover more frequently due to passive self-damage, forcing Giratina to cede momentum to the opponent. Dark Void is an option for the first moveslot which ignores Safety Goggles, at the cost of putting Giratina to sleep when used against a Magic Bounce user. Swagger can also be run in the first moveslot when paired with Imposter Chansey, as when Giratina is overwhelmed by a physical Mold Breaker user, it can use the move and either secure chip and heal itself or sack itself to bring Chansey in. Colbur Berry is an option that allows it to switch out of Huge Power Pursuit users one time without being as heavily damaged, though it is rather difficult to run due to the opportunity cost of not being able to block Spore, having passive recovery, or blocking Trick. Haze is an option over Encore that allows Giratina to check opposing Shell Smash sweepers in long games, as Encore is prone to getting PP stalled; however, this is only useful against physical Mold Breakers that Giratina naturally checks, like Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X.

Aside from Prankster and Magic Bounce, Giratina can run niche abilities in Poison Heal and Fur Coat; Poison Heal Giratina can defensively check Primal Groudon and Choice Band Mega Rayquaza more effectively, while Fur Coat Giratina has much less difficulty switching into Huge Power users. Poison Heal sets run Will-O-Wisp, Psycho Shift, Scald, or Steam Eruption in the first moveslot, King's Shield or Spiky Shield in the second moveslot, Curse, and Recover, with Toxic Orb as the item. Fur Coat Giratina enjoys running a similar moveset, but it favors running the same items that Prankster Giratina runs; however, Fur Coat Giratina does not rely on King's Shield as much, and it cannot run Psycho Shift viably. However, these abilities are not without their weaknesses: Poison Heal Giratina cannot disrupt Shell Smash sweepers that it is weak to, such as Mega Gengar, Mega Diancie, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga, the way Prankster Giratina would be able to, and Fur Coat Giratina is extremely passive and is generally outclassed by Prankster except against Huge Power users. No Guard Giratina is an extremely fringe option that exclusively relies on surprise, but a faster No Guard user, such as Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Mewtwo X, or Mega Aerodactyl, is virtually always superior.

Checks and Counters

Huge Power Dark-Types: Dark-type Huge Power users, like Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal, can force mindgames against Giratina through threatening both Pursuit and a conventional attack, usually Knock Off. However, Giratina can use Destiny Bond to force a trade between it and the Huge Power Dark-type, or run the niche Baton Pass to circumvent Pursuit.

Specially Offensive Pokemon: The vast majority of special Mold Breaker users can threaten Giratina, as Giratina is virtually always physically defensive and has a poor typing to deal with opposing special attackers. However, many special Mold Breakers rely on Plates to have a powerful STAB move or coverage, and Giratina running Trick can render said Plate users null as a threat once their Plate is removed. Even when not taking Mold Breaker users into account, specially offensive Pokemon, such as Protean Mega Latios and Choice Specs Gale Wings Mega Rayquaza, force Giratina out.

Wonder Guard Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir: Fairy-type Wonder Guard users with a respectable Special Attack stat, namely Xerneas and Mega Gardevoir, can force Giratina out with Moonblast; however, they must watch out for Glare, Will-O-Wisp, and Destiny Bond, as a loss of momentum, effectively being on a timer, or just being removed hampers the support they are able to give to the rest of the team.

Lum Berry Mega Mewtwo X: If Giratina is not healthy, Mega Mewtwo X with a Lum Berry can overwhelm Giratina, though Destiny Bond Giratina can force a trade between itself and Mega Mewtwo X.

-ate Users: Refrigerate, Pixilate, and Aerilate (collectively called -ate) users can force Giratina out by threatening either Fake Out + Extreme Speed or an extremely powerful Boomburst. Mega Diancie and Kyurem-B can threaten a KO against Giratina with Fake Out into Extreme Speed; Mega Abomasnow and Mega Rayquaza can potentially play around Giratina variants with Destiny Bond.

No Guard Users: By virtue of OHKOing every Pokemon that don't have Wonder Guard or Sturdy, No Guard users are adept at forcing Giratina out. However, Giratina can force a trade by using Destiny Bond on a OHKO move.

sets.name: Prankster
sets.description:
Prankster Giratina is the best blanket check to physical attackers in the metagame, as it is an untrappable check to Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X with amazing bulk and potentially an immunity to Trick. In addition, it has numerous possible options to try and circumvent its checks. Will-O-Wisp allows Giratina to cripple opposing Huge Power users without a Lum Berry and chips foes lacking recovery without resorting to Curse. Destiny Bond is also a great option, as it allows for a near-guaranteed trade, usually against a runaway sweeper. Spore annoys the likes of Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X lacking Safety Goggles, as well as Pokemon that would normally threaten Giratina like Mega Gengar, Mega Latios, and Mold Breaker Mega Diancie. Glare is another option that makes Primal Groudon and Huge Power users easier to deal with, but leaves Giratina vulnerable to Huge Power Pursuit users like Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal. Encore is integral to Giratina's ability to check sweepers, as locking opposing sweepers into setup moves like Shell Smash all but forces them out. Curse is extremely valuable, as many switch-ins to Giratina lack reliable recovery, and it is fairly easy for Giratina to find opportunities to heal itself. Recover is essential to Giratina's longevity. Safety Goggles is preferred, as it allows Giratina to be a sturdy check to Primal Groudon using Spore as disruption; Leftovers can be used to passively heal Giratina reduce chip damage from U-turn and entry hazards. Griseous Orb prevents Trick users, like Choice Band Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza, from locking Giratina into either a support move, preventing recovery until Giratina switches back in later in the game, or recovery, leaving Giratina a momentum sink.

Giratina can fit on virtually any team, as the widespread utility it provides on top of checking offensive Pokemon is unmatched. It effectively acts as a switch-in for Primal Groudon, Mega Mewtwo X, and offensive Choice Band Mold Breaker users. Giratina forms a crucial part of the metagame's most dominant core in Giratina, Primal Groudon, and Wonder Guard Xerneas. Giratina can come in on Huge Power-boosted Poison- and Steel-type attacks, while Xerneas can support the rest of the team with utility, such as Stealth Rock, Defog, Aromatherapy, and Glare; Giratina can also Imposter-proof Primal Groudon sets not running Dark Void. Additionally, Giratina can potentially use Glare and allow for Primal Groudon to pose a greater threat, or Destiny Bond to remove checks to this core like Mega Gengar and Protean Mega Latios. Both of these threats dislike having to win 50-50s against Pursuit and Sucker Punch users; thus Huge Power Dark-types, in particular Mega Gyarados, are good partners to Giratina. Aside from Mega Gyarados, -ate users that can threaten opposing Primal Groudon, such as Mega Abomasnow and Mega Rayquaza, are also good partners, as Giratina has trouble reliably checking Dark Void variants. On more defensive teams, Magic Bounce users that complement Giratina well typing-wise, such as Yveltal, Registeel, and occasionally Mega Venusaur and Ferrothorn, work well. Because of Wonder Guard Xerneas's prevalence and it being a common switch-in to Giratina, Shadow Tag users, in particular Mega Mewtwo X, are great partners to Giratina.

Cresselia.comments:
Other Options

116 Speed EVs can be used outpace and escape Huge Power Yveltal's Pursuit, though doing so comes at the cost of Cresselia's survivability versus Mold Breaker users, as well as the ability to underspeed minimum Speed Wonder Guard Arceus. A specially defensive set, though hard to justify when Cresselia is so effective at scouting physically offensive Mold Breakers, is also an option to improve Cresselia's matchup against Choice Specs Mold Breaker users and to let it survive a single Bug Buzz from Protean Latios. Colbur Berry is another option to improve Cresselia's matchup against Pursuit trappers, allowing it to risk the 50 / 50 a single time versus Mega Gyarados; however, forgoing Shed Shell comes at the cost of increased vulnerability to Shadow Tag users like Perish Song Lugia. Safety Goggles is another option that can allow Cresselia to soft check some Spore Mold Breaker Shell Smash sweepers alongside either Whirlwind or Glare—although it similarly leaves Cresselia vulnerable to Shadow Tag users. Mail is a final option to make Cresselia immune to Trick.

Though a little difficult to fit, Glare is an option to punish Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar that Cresselia lures in. Similarly, Will-O-Wisp is an option to cripple incoming Huge Power users, continuously chip special attackers lacking recovery, and to limit the number of times Substitute + Baton Pass users like Xerneas and Mega Mewtwo Y can use Substitute. Substitute can be used alongside Baton Pass, but this role is typically filled better by less passive Wonder Guard users, such as Xerneas. Perish Song is an alternative to Whirlwind to put any opponent, but especially Whirlwind-immune Substitute + Baton Pass Magic Bounce users, on a timer. Magic Coat is an option to reflect sleep moves from Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon looking to use Cresselia as a setup opportunity, as well as Parting Shot and Stealth Rock from -ate Speed users like Mega Abomasnow and Sing, Gastro Acid, Taunt, and Spider Web from No Guard users. Finally, a set with both King's Shield and Baton Pass is viable, but it severely limits the utility Cresselia can offer its team.

Checks and Counters

Huge Power Pursuit: Despite measures to mitigate Cresselia's weakness to Pursuit, it is still very vulnerable to Huge Power Pursuit users like Mega Gyarados and Yveltal. Even if running additional speed EVs to outpace Yveltal, Cresselia still has to be wary of being trapped while paralyzed or afflicted with a Speed drop from Sticky Web, especially since Cresselia is often the team's cleric and entry hazard remover. Sets lacking Baton Pass have to be played even more carefully in a matchup versus Huge Power Pursuit.

Knock Off: Thanks to its Dark-type weakness, Cresselia is vulnerable to having its Shed Shell removed by Knock Off, leaving it vulnerable to Shadow Tag users, or just being outright KOed by Dark-type Huge Power users.

Trick: Unless it's holding Mail, Trick users can hinder Cresselia for the entirety of the match, forcing it to either use Baton Pass or relinquish momentum.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: Shell Smash Mold Breakers like Mega Gengar, Mega Tyranitar, Mega Diancie, and Arceus can swap in on nearly every Cresselia set risk free use it as setup fodder. In addition, if Cresselia forgoes King's Shield, it's also forced out without much difficulty by Choice Band Primal Groudon.

Prankster Giratina: Like is the case with most defensive Wonder Guard users, Prankster Giratina can come in on virtually every Cresselia set and force it out with Encore, chip it with Will-O-Wisp, or leave it vulnerable to Pursuit trapping with Glare.

Unfavorable Matchup: Despite its impressive bulk, like any Wonder Guard user, Cresselia is still vulnerable to being OHKOed by powerful foes carrying the right coverage such as Beat Up Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Bug Buzz Protean Mega Latios. King's Shield variants of Cresselia, however, can scout the aforementioned foes and somewhat mitigate the disadvantage of an unfavorable matchup.

sets.name: Support Wonder Guard
sets.description:
Thanks to its titanic bulk, decent Speed tier, and good pure Psychic typing, Cresselia is an excellent support Wonder Guard user, reliably providing cleric support, Wish passing, entry hazard removal, entry hazard setting, and pivoting support for its teammates. In addition to the utility a pivoting move provides, Baton Pass also allows Cresselia to escape its greatest enemy—Pursuit—provided it is faster than its foe. Thankfully, Cresselia is naturally faster than the most common Pursuit user, Huge Power Mega Gyarados. Alternatively, King's Shield eases Cresselia's matchup versus Pursuit users while also improving Cresselia's matchup against powerful physical foes like Choice Band Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza. Defog and Aromatherapy are extremely valuable support options on the majority of team structures, but if another teammate is carrying either one, Cresselia can also opt to support its team with Stealth Rock instead. Whirlwind is another option that synergizes well with entry hazards and allows Cresselia to force out Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard users like Xerneas. Finally, recovery is essential for this set to function. Recover's immediate recovery is usually superior on sets lacking King's Shield, while Wish allows Cresselia to support its teammates and has good synergy with both King's Shield and Baton Pass. Shed Shell is the preferred item, as it makes Cresselia much more resilient against Shadow Tag users, requiring a teammate to remove its item with Trick or Knock Off before it can be trapped. A physically defensive EV spread is used to better scout Choice Band Mold Breaker users, as Cresselia's typing and natural bulk allow it to switch into the likes of Choice Specs Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Rayquaza once even without investment. A Bold Nature and 31 Speed IVs allow Cresselia to outspeed opposing Mega Gyarados with no Speed EVs, allowing it to escape Mega Gyarados's Pursuit with Baton Pass. Alternatively, if vulnerability to Pursuit trappers isn't a concern, a Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs can be used to allow Cresselia to underspeed other common slow pivots such as Xerneas and Primal Kyogre.

Like is the case with all support Wonder Guard users, most teams benefit from the utility Cresselia can provide in the form of Aromatherapy, entry hazard removal or setting, pivoting, and Wish passing. In addition, Cresselia can also support Huge Power or Protean teammates lacking a Dark-, Bug-, or Ghost-type attack as a switch-in for them against Imposter users. Cresselia can similarly support Choice Specs Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Rayquaza against Imposter users. Wonder Guard Xerneas is a particularly notable teammate for Cresselia, as it has an excellent matchup against Huge Power Mega Gyarados and other Pursuit trappers in addition to forming a strong Wonder Guard core with it. Alternatively, Cresselia can also pair well with offensive Wonder Guard users like Mega Lucario and Shell Smash Xerneas thanks to their positive matchup into Pursuit users, as well as Cresselia's own ability to effectively compress the roles of cleric and defogger. Offensive Shadow Tag users that aren't weak to Water, such as a Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X, also make effective teammates for Cresselia, as they can trap and remove the aforementioned Mega Gyarados. Ironically, Cresselia's greatest nemeses—Huge Power Dark-types like Mega Gyarados, Mega Tyranitar, and Yveltal—are also stellar teammates for it, serving as offensive checks against Shell Smash Mold Breaker users, especially with Sucker Punch. Similarly, -ate Speed users such as Mega Rayquaza and Mega Abomasnow are also excellent teammates for that same ability to check and revenge kill Shell Smash Mold Breaker users. In addition, -ate Speed users are excellent entry hazard setters and can either form a entry hazard stacking core with Cresselia or free up a moveslot for Whirlwind or other utility move.

Audino.comments:
Other Options

Mega Audino can run Knock Off to fully dismantle Mega Gengar, weaken opposing Mega Latios, and remove Prankster Giratina's Safety Goggles for offensive teammates running Spore. Whirlwind and Perish Song are options that can be used when threatening Mold Breaker sweepers like Primal Groudon try to switch into Mega Audino or when Wonder Guard users like Xerneas try to pass a Substitute to a teammate. This isn't as common because Mega Audino can either just predict a switch and pivot to Pokemon more suited to deal with sweepers, or it can be pressured by the Mold Breaker sweeper through continuous status infliction. U-turn is an alternative pivot move that can maintain momentum against Taunt users such as Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and slightly chip physically frail Mold Breaker users coming in, such as Mega Mewtwo Y. However, the loss of momentum against opposing Wonder Guard users usually isn't worth it. A Lum Berry can help Mega Audino heal from sleep or bad poison from Toxic Spikes, but its one-time use can prove inefficient. Wonder Guard is best for longevity, but Prankster and Magic Bounce give Mega Audino more flexibility to run support moves. OHKO moves can be useful as a shock factor to offensive threats and can OHKO opposing No Guard users, but they almost always aren't worth running due to being inconsistent. Mega Audino can also use hazards to punish opposing switch-ins. Lastly, Mega Audino can run a variety of other support moves like Glare, Chatter, and Will-O-Wisp to help advance its teammates further.

Checks and Counters

Unfavorable Matchup: Various Pokemon including Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X, Protean Mega Latios, Protean Mega Mewtwo Y, and Wonder Guard Xerneas often run super effective coverage moves against Mega Audino to force it out.

Giratina: Giratina can be sent out against Mega Audino to run Curse against it, as Curse can be passed by Baton Pass. Additionally, a Giratina with Magic Bounce would not be able to let Mega Audino run Parting Shot in to escape and a Prankster Giratina can force Mega Audino out with Encore. However, Prankster Giratina must be careful when using Curse against Mega Audino with Parting Shot, as Mega Audino using the move the same turn Giratina uses Curse prevents Curse from affecting it, while Giratina is left less healthy.

Mold Breaker Shell Smash Users: Mold Breaker users carrying Shell Smash can use Mega Audino's passivity to set up on it. They can also put Mega Audino to sleep with Spore or Dark Void—the former requires Safety Goggles to block more than once, while the latter cannot be consistently blocked by any item—or inflict chip damage with a powerful attack. However, some Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Gengar lacking a Poison-type STAB move, struggle to get past Mega Audino without getting lucky with sleep.

Shadow Tag Perish Trappers: Mega Audino without Shed Shell is very vulnerable to removal by Shadow Tag users. If swapped in on any move bar Baton Pass or Parting Shot, the Shadow Tag user can Encore Mega Audino, set three layers of Spikes, and remove it with Perish Song.

Taunt Users: Taunt shuts down all Mega Audino sets bar those using U-turn, Magic Coat, or non-status utility moves like Nuzzle and Knock Off.

sets.name: Wonder Guard Support
sets.description:
Though it has an opportunity cost in not being able to be run with Wonder Guard Xerneas, Mega Audino is a premier Wonder Guard user in the Pure Hackmons metagame due to having an amazing defensive typing, being a very slow pivot, and being able to soft-check the likes of Mega Gengar lacking a Poison-type STAB move and Mega Latios lacking Shell Smash. Mega Audino can make use of either Recover to keep itself healthy or Wish with its high HP stat to keep both its teammates and itself healthy, though relying on Wish to heal makes it significantly more difficult to retain momentum. Aromatherapy and Defog are two of the best forms of support any defensive Wonder Guard user can offer its teammates. The former cures Mega Audino and its teammates of status ailments that they would otherwise be annoyed with, while the latter helps to minimize the amount of chip damage that offensive teammates take over the course of the game. King's Shield gives Mega Audino the chance to scout offensive Pokemon that like to switch into it, such as Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, as well as allowing Mega Audino to force out many variants of said switch-ins after an Attack drop. Magic Coat helps Mega Audino's longevity by reflecting back status-inflicting moves like Spore, Dark Void, Will-O-Wisp, and Glare, as well as moves that would otherwise force Mega Audino out, like Taunt and Encore. A pivoting move is almost always required for Mega Audino to retain momentum for its team; Parting Shot is a solid option that can weaken offensive switch-ins, but it causes Mega Audino to struggle to maintain momentum against teams with a Magic Bounce user; however, Baton Pass is the preferred option due to its high PP and freedom pivoting. Mega Audino wants to be as physically bulky as possible in order to scout and pivot out of powerful physical attackers such as Mega Mewtwo X and Primal Groudon; a Relaxed nature with maximum HP and Defense investment and minimum Speed IVs help Mega Audino perform this function of a defensive cleric, soft-check specific Mold Breaker users, and act as a slow pivot. Shed Shell is the preferred item to prevent Mega Audino from being removed by Shadow Tag users, while Safety Goggles helps Mega Audino against Spore users like Mold Breaker users and Prankster Giratina.

Mega Audino should only be used in rare semi-stall teams, bulky balance teams, and teams with enough offensive pressure to prefer the defensive roles Xerneas cannot perform as well in. Semi-stall is rare due to limits in teambuilding, but these teams can have Ho-Oh and Mega Steelix cover Mega Audino's weaknesses. Glass cannons, such as Mold Breaker Mega Gengar, Mold Breaker Mega Diancie, and Choice Band Mold Breaker Mega Rayquaza, appreciate Mega Audino's ability to bring them onto the field safely. In addition, these Pokemon also all appreciate Mega Audino's ability to clear entry hazards and cure status. Mega Audino also Imposter-proofs most offensive teammates lacking Poison-type and Steel-type moves, including Mold Breakers like Mega Rayquaza, Mega Latios, Dialga, and Mega Tyranitar. Mega Audino's vulnerability to Mold Breaker Primal Groudon and coverage attackers like Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Latios in an unfavorable matchup makes -ate Speed users like Mega Rayquaza, Kyurem-B, and Mega Abomasnow valuable teammates. Notably, Mega Abomasnow is able to revenge kill the majority of Primal Groudon sets thanks to its resistance to Thousand Arrows, a powerful Boomburst, and Primal Groudon not being able to fit in a Fire-type STAB move and King's Shield on the same set. Mega Audino appreciates being part of most Wonder Guard cores. Cresselia, Mega Scizor, and Mega Manectric are all great examples of solid Wonder Guard partners, since Mega Audino compresses a lot of utility into one teamslot and carries distinct weaknesses. SubPass Wonder Guard users like Mega Swampert and Primal Groudon make for strong partners, since they appreciate the support Wish Mega Audino gives while providing the main support Mega Audino cannot offer. Offensive Shell Smash Wonder Guard sweepers like Mega Lucario and Primal Groudon also pair well with it. Finally, King's Shield Mega Audino can form a solid Wonder Guard core with Wonder Guard users weak to contact moves like Blissey and specially defensive Primal Kyogre.

Kyurem-Black.comments:
Other Options

Kyurem-B can also opt to run a physical coverage move like Gunk Shot, Freeze-Dry, Close Combat, or Thousand Arrows to hit unsuspecting Wonder Guard users that would switch in to block its Ice-type STAB moves. Spikes, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web can replace Stealth Rock. Will-O-Wisp can also replace it to status and chip Wonder Guard users that switch in. A Brave nature with 0 Speed IVs can be used on Boomburst sets to move slower than some Wonder Guard users' pivots. Kyurem-B can also run King's Shield because all of its main competitors (Regigigas, Slaking, Mega Diancie, and Mega Rayquaza) tend to outspeed it. It can then threaten to beat any of these one-on-one if they lack a King's Shield and Boomburst of their own.

Checks and Counters

Wonder Guard: Because Kyurem-B usually forgoes running coverage, Wonder Guard Pokemon aren't afraid of it, and some can even set up in front of it. However, Kyurem-B sets running Gastro Acid can circumvent this to an extent, as once Wonder Guard is removed, most Wonder Guard users are forced out, granting the Kyurem-B user momentum.

Other Priority Users: In a one-on-one scenario, faster -ate Speed users, like Mega Diancie and Mega Rayquaza, are able to outspeed Kyurem and hit hard with Fake Out into Extreme Speed.

King's Shield + Mold Breaker Sweepers: Bulky Mold Breaker sweepers that run King's Shield, such as Primal Groudon, Mega Tyranitar, and Dialga, force Kyurem-B to play mind games every time they set up and Kyurem-B comes in. Primal Groudon is particularly threatening, as it has exceptional physical bulk for a Shell Smash sweeper and can run a sleep move and King's Shield on the same set viably.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Shadow Tag Primal Groudon and Mega Mewtwo X can punish Kyurem-B heavily by surviving an Extreme Speed and attacking back with their strong attacks, like V-create and Drain Punch.

Bulky Steel-types: Pokemon like Magic Bounce Registeel and Mega Steelix have high Defense to absorb Kyurem-B's attacks with ease, removing any progress it makes with their recovery.

sets.name: Refrigerate
sets.description:
Through its use of priority Ice-type STAB attacks, Refrigerate Kyurem-B acts as an effective revenge killer, sweep-stopper, and general offensive powerhouse. Fake Out + Extreme Speed can easily dispatch most No Guard users and Shell Smash sweepers lacking King's Shield, as well as chunking bulky Ice-weak support Pokemon like Giratina. Boomburst can be used to damage sweepers behind Substitute, as well as immediately threatening Magic Bounce Giratina and unboosted Primal Groudon. Pursuit gives Kyurem-B the option to punish physically frail foes, like Mega Gengar and Mega Latios, on a switch out. Sacred Fire is an option to threaten bulky Steel-types like Mega Scizor, Registeel, and Mega Steelix, which makes Stealth Rock easier to use in matchups against said foes. Stealth Rock itself is a great way to punish switches. Finally, Gastro Acid instead lets Kyurem-B force most Wonder Guard Pokemon out, escape offensive Shadow Tag users, and remove Mold Breaker from sweepers running King's Shield if it predicts correctly. Lum Berry is used to avoid sleep from Mold Breaker sweepers once and dodge other status if they aren't in play, while Icicle Plate buffs Kyurem-B's Ice-type moves and gives it the power to KO Giratina with Boomburst after Stealth Rock. On sets running Boomburst, a Naughty nature is preferred to avoid lowering Kyurem-B's Special Attack; otherwise, an Adamant nature is preferred. Maximum Defense investment allows it to survive one V-create or Thousand Arrows from boosted Primal Groudon at full.

Kyurem-B fits best on offensive teams that appreciate it revenge killing frailer threats that outspeed its teammates. Kyurem-B's largest weakness is its inability to consistently damage Wonder Guard users because of its narrow coverage. Because of this, it benefits greatly from Mold Breaker teammates like Mega Gengar, Pokemon that use a wide variety of coverage moves like offensive Wonder Guard Xerneas, and Perish Song trappers like Lugia. Choice Scarf + No Guard Mega Mewtwo X and Mega Mewtwo Y can help the matchup against Primal Groudon. Additionally, special attackers like the Mega Mewtwo Y or Mega Gengar can stop physical walls from walling Kyurem-B out. Finally, due to its Stealth Rock weakness, Defog support is needed to maximize its longevity when switching in to revenge kill.

Meloetta.comments:
Other Options

An alternate EV Spread of 248 HP / 28 Def / 232 SpD with a Calm nature maximizes Meloetta's special bulk while allowing it to avoid the 2HKO from Mold Breaker Mega Gengar's Secret Sword after Stealth Rock. 76 Speed EVs can be used outpace Huge Power Yveltal and escape its Pursuit, though doing so cuts into Meloetta's chance of surviving attacks from Mold Breaker users like Mega Gengar and usually isn't worth it due to Huge Power Yveltal's relative rarity. Colbur Berry is an option on physically defensive sets, allowing it to avoid the Pursuit trapper mind game once. Safety Goggles and Chesto Berry are options that can improve Meloetta's matchup against Mold Breaker users using Spore and Dark Void, respectively. Mail is a final option that makes Meloetta immune to Trick. All these options, however, leave Meloetta vulnerable to Shadow Tag users like Perish Song Lugia and Choice Band Mega Mewtwo X.

Psystrike is a decent option that OHKOes Mega Gengar, even without investment, making it a much more reliable check—especially alongside Chesto Berry or Safety Goggles—though it has little utility outside of hitting Mega Gengar. Glare is another option that, like Whirlwind, makes Meloetta a situational check to some special Shell Smash Mold Breaker or Wonder Guard sweepers. Perish Song is an alternative to Whirlwind that fares better versus Magic Bounce Substitute + Baton Pass users like Giratina. Nuzzle and Chatter are niche options that can disrupt opposing sweepers and also make Meloetta less vulnerable to Taunt users. Steam Eruption is an option to OHKO standard Primal Groudon, but has little utility otherwise. Parting Shot and U-Turn are alternate pivoting options over Baton Pass. However, the former cedes momentum Magic Bounce users, the latter cedes momentum to Wonder Guard users, and, unlike Baton Pass, neither move evades a slower Pursuit. Finally, Magic Coat is an option to reflect sleep moves from Mold Breaker users, Stealth Rock from -ate Speed users, and Sing, Gastro Acid, Taunt, and Spider Web from No Guard users.

Checks and Counters

Huge Power Pursuit: Despite King's Shield and Baton Pass mitigating Meloetta's weakness to Pursuit, it still has to be wary of being Pursuit trapped while paralyzed, when facing the uncommon but relevant Sticky Web, and when facing faster Pursuit users—particularly since Meloetta is often its team's cleric or entry hazard remover.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: Shell Smash Mold Breakers like Primal Groudon, Mega Tyranitar, and Arceus set up safely on any Meloetta set not carrying Whirlwind or niche options like Glare or Chatter. In addition, if Meloetta forgoes King's Shield, it's also forced out by powerful physical attackers like Choice Band Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza.

Unfavorable Matchup: Like any Wonder Guard user, Meloetta is vulnerable to powerful Huge Power, Protean, and Parental Bond attackers carrying the right coverage moves—such as Beat Up Huge Power Mega Mewtwo X and Bug Buzz Protean Mega Latios.

Knock Off: Meloetta is vulnerable to Knock Off, which either removes its Shed Shell, leaving it vulnerable to Shadow Tag users, or KOes it outright.

Trick: Unless it's holding Mail, Trick users can hinder Meloetta for the entirety of the match, forcing it to either use Baton Pass or relinquish momentum.

Prankster Giratina: As is the case with the majority of support Wonder Guard users, Prankster Giratina can force Meloetta out with Encore and chip it with Will-O-Wisp and Curse. Additionally, Giratina's Glare can also leave Meloetta vulnerable to slower Pursuit users it would ordinarily evade.

Taunt: Taunt forces out nearly all Meloetta sets. Even those making use of niche options like Psystrike or Nuzzle become limited in their ability to maintain momentum and support their team.

sets.name: Wonder Guard Support
sets.description:
Meloetta's unique typing, good bulk, and flexible Speed tier make it a strong option for a support Wonder Guard user. Baton Pass allows Meloetta to provide pivoting support to its teammates while also escaping slower Pursuit users, such as Huge Power Mega Gyarados. King's Shield is an alternative that can similarly ease Meloetta's matchup versus Pursuit users while also letting it scout for its team and improving its one-on-one matchup versus powerful physical threats like Choice Band Mold Breaker Primal Groudon. Defog and Aromatherapy are valuable support options for nearly every team composition. However, if a teammate is carrying either or both, Meloetta can make use of other utility options like Whirlwind and Stealth Rock. Notably, Whirlwind can make Meloetta a situational check to many special Shell Smash Mold Breaker and Wonder Guard sweepers, as well as force out Substitute + Baton Pass users like the ever popular Wonder Guard Xerneas. Finally, recovery is essential for Meloetta to function effectively. Recover's immediacy and reliability is generally preferred, but Wish is an alternative that allows Meloetta to support its teammates and synergizes well with King's Shield and Baton Pass. Shed Shell is the preferred item, as it makes Meloetta much less susceptible to Shadow Tag users. The given EV spread maximizes Meloetta's physical bulk while also giving it the ability to survive Mold Breaker Mega Gengar's +2 Sludge Wave after Stealth Rock. This is notable, as Meloetta's immunity to Ghost and good bulk allow it to soft check Mold Breaker Mega Gengar whether it's carrying Secret Sword or Sludge Wave. Finally, if Pursuit trappers aren't a concern, Meloetta can make use of a Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs to underspeed popular slow pivots like Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas.

Like is the case with all support Wonder Guard users, Meloetta fits on a wide variety of team structures. Its weakness to Pursuit users means that Meloetta appreciates teammates such as Substitute + Baton Pass Wonder Guard Xerneas, as well as Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario. Choice Specs Mold Breaker users, such as Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Rayquaza, appreciate specially defensive Meloetta's ability to Imposter-proof them thanks to its unique typing and good special bulk. Choice Specs Mold Breaker Mega Mewtwo Y is worth noting in particular, as even physically defensive variants of Meloetta can Imposter-proof it with Whirlwind or by using Baton Pass to pivot to a revenge killer like Sucker Punch Mega Gyarados. Additionally, Pursuit trappers like Huge Power Mega Gyarados and Yveltal are excellent teammates for Meloetta, checking Shell Smash Mold Breakers users and Pursuit trapping Prankster Giratina. Furthermore, Pursuit users can trap Imposter users copying variants of Meloetta lacking Baton Pass. -ate Speed users like Mega Rayquaza and Mega Abomasnow are also helpful teammates for Meloetta, as they force out the majority of Mold Breaker sweepers after being brought in safely by Meloetta's Baton Pass. On bulkier teams, Meloetta can be run alongside another defensive Wonder Guard user, allowing for more flexibility with both their movesets. In particular, Wonder Guard users that can switch into physical attackers for Meloetta, but are perhaps more vulnerable to Mold Breaker Mega Gengar—such as Mega Scizor and Mega Swampert—synergize very well with Meloetta. Finally, offensive Shadow Tag users such as Mega Rayquaza and Mega Mewtwo X are valuable teammates as they can trap the Pursuit trappers that Meloetta fears.

Genesect.comments:
Other Options

An EV spread of 252 Atk / 4 SpA / 252 Spe alongside a Naughty nature can be used to OHKO physically defensive Primal Kyogre with +2 Bolt Strike and standard Wonder Guard Xerneas with +2 Gear Grind while still OHKOing Bug / Steel type Wonder Guard users with Techno Blast. However, such a set is largely outclassed by Mega Lucario and Mega Scizor, of which the former has higher Speed, better overall damage output, and can OHKO Primal Groudon at +2 with its Fist Plate Judgment. Genesect has a few other viable coverage options available to it; Scald OHKOes most variants of Primal Groudon without needing to boost first, Aura Sphere hits Normal-type Wonder Guard users not named Blissey or Chansey harder than Secret Sword, Night Daze hits Wonder Guard Dusclops, Knock Off removes items and hits Psychic-type Wonder Guard users, and Giga Drain hits Water-type Wonder Guard users like Mega Swampert while also providing recovery. Finally, Flame Plate and Judgment are options over Burn Drive and Techno Blast if Judgment’s greater PP is valued more than the immunity to item removal that Burn Drive grants.

Checks and Counters

Fire-type Coverage: A quadruple weakness to Fire and below average bulk means that Genesect drops to even relatively weak Fire-type attacks. Furthermore, Sacred Fire, V-Create, Searing Shot, and Lava Plume are all very common coverage moves on Huge Power, Protean, Parental Bond, and opposing Shell Smash + Wonder Guard users.

Powerful Mold Breaker Users: A weakness to powerful Mold Breaker users like Primal Groudon and Mega Rayquaza isn't unique to Genesect. However, unlike other Wonder Guard + Shell Smash sweepers like Mega Gardevoir and Mega Lucario, Genesect's comparatively low Special Attack means that it cannot OHKO many Mold Breaker users even after a Shell Smash depending on its coverage moves, leaving it vulnerable to being OHKOed in return.

Opposing Wonder Guard: Wonder Guard sweepers are inherently matchup dependent, so Wonder Guard users Genesect's coverage can’t touch will force it out.

Prankster Giratina: Genesect's relatively low Special Attack for a Wonder Guard + Shell Smash sweeper means that Giratina can easily switch in and force an unboosted Genesect out. In particular, Haze variants of Giratina can wall Genesect almost endlessly, barring an unlucky freeze from Freeze-Dry. Once Genesect is neutralized with Encore or Haze, Giratina can also chip it with Will-O-Wisp or remove its sweeping potential with Glare.

Offensive Shadow Tag Users: Genesect's lack of a Shed Shell leaves it vulnerable to offensive Shadow Tag users like Mega Mewtwo Y, Mega Mewtwo X, and Primal Groudon. However, they cannot consistently check a boosted Genesect depending on its coverage moves; +2 Bug Buzz OHKOes Mega Mewtwo Y, +2 Moonblast OHKOes Mega Mewtwo X, and +2 Earth Power OHKOes Primal Groudon.

sets.name: Shell Smash Wonder Guard
sets.description:
Genesect's good Special Attack, solid Bug / Steel typing, and unique interaction with Burn Drive make it a decent option for a Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweeper. Techno Blast and Burn Drive allow Genesect to both Imposter-proof itself and OHKO opposing Bug / Steel Wonder Guard users. Additionally, Burn Drive grants Genesect an immunity to Trick without sacrificing its ability to beat Imposter users—a property that only Fist Plate Arceus shares among Wonder Guard Shell Smash sweepers. The remaining two moveslots are devoted to coverage moves to hit as many Wonder Guard users as possible. Flash Cannon is a decently powerful Steel-type STAB that hits Xerneas, Mega Audino, and Mega Gardevoir. Earth Power hits Mega Manectric and Mega Lucario, in addition to OHKOing Primal Groudon at +2.
